newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes slightly weaker in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes slightly weaker in slow trade.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed slightly weaker against its American counterpart in quiet trade on Thursday and dealers expected the sluggish sentiment to continue.
The local unit ended at US$27.492 million against Wednesday's T$27.489 finish. Turnover was US$151 million.
A lack of inspiring news in the market kept some players sidelined though there are still expectations for U.S. dollar selling before the Chinese new year on February 7.
"The market follows a recent trend of moving narrowly, just like in the past few months," said one dealer.
